questions.question: Which famous museum houses Leonardo da Vinci's Mona Lisa and was originally built as a fortress in 1190?
questions.context: Located on the banks of the Seine River, this museum in France is the world's largest art museum and a historic monument.

questions.question: Where is the architectural marvel that features the tallest man-made structure in the world, standing at 828 meters?
questions.context: Found in the United Arab Emirates, this building reached its full height in 2010 and has an observation deck on the 148th floor.

questions.question: What ancient ruin, known for its unique step pyramid and as the heart of an advanced civilization, can be found on the Yucatán Peninsula?
questions.context: This site in Mexico includes the Kukulkan Pyramid and was a center of Mayan civilization around 600 AD.

questions.question: Which space exploration site served as the launch site for the Apollo 11 mission to the moon in 1969?
questions.context: Located on Merritt Island, USA, this site is a major center for spaceflight operations, named after the 35th President of the United States.

questions.question: Which historical battle site, located in Belgium, marked the defeat of Napoleon Bonaparte on June 18, 1815?
questions.context: This site is famous for the clash between Napoleon's army and the Seventh Coalition forces, which changed the course of European history.
